intro: Chrysophtalmum gueneri, commonly known as the golden eye or sunflower of the desert, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysophtalmum gueneri is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
